alert.note: Alert for DeKalb; Gwinnett; North Fulton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 7:14PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern DeKalb, southwestern Gwinnett and northeastern Fulton Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 714 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Sandy Springs, or 9 miles east of Marietta, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, up to penny sized hail, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Atlanta, Peachtree Corners, Sandy Springs, Dunwoody, Snellville, Lilburn, Chamblee, Norcross, Doraville, Clarkston, Stone Mountain, Tucker, North Atlanta, North Decatur, North Druid Hills, Mountain Park, Mechanicsville, Brookhaven and Chastain Memorial Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM EDT for north central Georgia.
